name: Harbour Grand Hong Kong

reviews.text: We visited Hong Kong during the Easter holidays and chose this new hotel. When we arrived to our room and looked out of the window…!!! Apparently every room has a harbour view and image lying in bed, switching off the light and just looking at the harbour lights! The hotel is a 5 minutes walk from the Victoria Park on Hong Kong Island. They have regular shuttle buses to the Central and to TaiKooShing where there are shopping malls and cinemas. Supermarkets, restaurants (of various cuisines), and shops are very near the hotel and therefore incredibly convenient. The underground (MTR) is only 2 minutes away.
reviews.title: Great View, good location to enjoy the city while stranded in Hong Kong

reviews.text: It was the day we were supposed to be leaving when our plane was cancelled because of the volcanic ash! Thankfully the concierge checked on-line and told me not to bother going to the airport but to extend our room stay because “there will be hundreds of stranded travellers checking into this hotel by the airlines!” Luckily we followed his advice and used our unexpected 9 extra days in Hong Kong to enjoy the sights while I managed to do some work thanks to the internet.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!!!

reviews.text: I have to congratulate the team at the hotel in making our stay so comfortable and their efforts in helping us in every way during the crisis. We all agreed that if one has to be stranded, this would be the best place!
reviews.title: A very nice & comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start from the top, we arrived at the hotel at 11.30pm with 4 very tired children 7, 6, 4, 2. the hotel foyer is lovely, fresh open and welcoming. We had booked 2 rooms interconnecting, however on arrival they put us in 2 seperate rooms, thats ok we were so bloody tired we would have slept on steps, but before i hit the hay i went down and spoke to the lads on desk and explained that we needed an interconnecting room becuase of the kids, and without a problem the young man showed me the room on the 37th floor and happily moved us in there first thing in the morning. Well breakfast in the cafe was brilliant plennty of choices excellent staff couldnt do enough to help and what a fantastic place to be. We stayed 8 nights the guys at the desk to the people at the door they were excellent. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and these guys were sensational. The rooms are clean and comfortable we had 4 kids in one room 1 in a cot and 3 in 2 x big beds very good. The views are excellent sometimes foggy but excellent.
reviews.title: Don't bother..............pay the extra and stay somewhere else.

reviews.text: I rreccomend this lovely out of the way hotel....you get a good feel of hong kong here not touristy at all but not too far from the touristy areas.
reviews.title: location & service lets the hotel down

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights in this 5 star hotel this week. We chose it because it looked great on the pictures (hotel has good website) and the price was quite affordable for such a fine hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with excellent views

reviews.text: We took a harbour view room that had really fabulous views to both Kowloon and Hongkong sides. The pictures on the hotels site are great and give you accurate view of this brand new hotel. It celebrated it´s 1st year this week so everythin was brand new and shining.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant!!!

reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They arranged the room for us even though we got there in the morning and for no extra charge!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel! What a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was heated and had great views. Our daughter wanted to visit the pool every day.
reviews.title: This Hotel is Superb!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very stylish, though not very big. Room had 42inch Panasonic flat hd-tv and there were many hd-channels available. The shower/wc also had a small tv as well.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Harbour Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for nine nights, the only complaints we had were that we were in a room near the inside corner of the building so our views were slightly restricted.I thought we were in a deluxe not a grand deluxe room with being in this position but the staff insisted it was right but didn't seem to be very knowledgable about this.The other thing I didn't like was that the toilet wasn't clean, it had blue flush and the stains in the bowl were still quite visible and it stayed that way. Apart from that we had a very nice stay, the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. It was nice to go outside and not be pestered with people trying to sell you watches and make you clothes as we were on other holidays here. MTR is only a couple of blocks away as is the tram and we used the free shuttle on a few occasions. We had the buffet b/fast every morning and also had dinner at the Cantonese restaurant in the hotel both were excellent. Iwould stay here again
reviews.title: Nice hotel away from the crowds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Harbour Grand Hong Kong for 6 nights. We were on holiday/visiting friends and this was our second visit to Hong Kong. From check-in through to check-out all of the staff we came into contact with were happy, polite, attentive and genuinely seemed keen to help. An upgrade to a room on one of the Club Floors (which included complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea etc in the Harbour Club Lounge) was offered on check-in. At the time we declined this as we weren't sure how often we would eat in the hotel. On reflection this would probably have been a good deal as the daily upgrade charge was only a few HK dollars more than the cost of breakfast for 2 in the Harbour Grand Cafe. If you're planning to take breakfast in the hotel each day it's probably worth taking the upgrade package and making the most of the additional things included.
reviews.title: Great view, great service and great value for money

reviews.text: We had a Deluxe Harbour View Room on 31st floor. The view of the harbour, Causeway Bay and Kowloon was great and the room was well equipped, although a little short on storage space if there's two of you, with too many clothes and you're staying more than a couple of nights, but extra coat-hangers were quickly provided on request! Beds and pillows are very comfortable and bedding is also high quality - best nights sleep for ages for both of us. The glass wall between the bathroom and the bedroom was a bit unusual but there is an electrically operated blind for privacy if you're sharing. The bathroom was dominated by a large circular bathtub which was lovely for relaxing in after a hard day's shopping/sightseeing. However it is a little difficult to get in and out of due to the position of the sliding glass door and the basin and toilet are a little short on space around them. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are not large, but no smaller than many in London and other big cities. Cleaning standards were good and unlike a previous reviewer we did get a turn-down service every day during our visit.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience with great Harbour views from 21st floor

reviews.text: We had breakfast twice in the Harbour Grand Cafe which we thought was very good - a large buffet with something to suit all tastes and good quality coffee. We also had the buffet dinner once. This was typical international hotel style but an excellent selection, well presented and good quality. It included an array of seafood (lobster, oysters, mussels, prawns etc), Chinese, Indian and Thai dishes, various salads, a choice of roast meats and numerous desserts. We thought it was very good value - it worked out at less than 400 HKD per person due to a discount available at the time of our visit and included unlimited food, soft drinks and house wine (not the best but drinkable) . We didn't eat at any of the other restaurants in the hotel although we did check them out. and they looked good but expensive. The view from Le 188 has to be one of the best in Hong Kong - we planned to get a drink there after returning to the hotel one evening but as we were both wearing flip flops unfortunately there dress code meant we were very politely declined!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay, Great Ambience..

reviews.text: The Pool area is attractive with a great view of the water. We noticed menus on the tables and food being served to other guests so it seems they've now introduced a pool side service.
reviews.title: Underwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent choice of hotel. Close to metro and trams, the nearby restaurants and harbour makes this a good choice. No hassles form people selling watches or suits, the neighbourhood is fine, even the nearby mechanics and tin bath adds a touch of realism to the up market experience given by the hotel. Traveling on a budget, we decided against paying the 27€ for breakfast , but don't worry, there are plenty of places nearby to eat! I did find the 5€ for 15mins internet connection a bit much, but maybe that's the price one pays when staying in such hotels. That aside, the stay was well worth the money and the view from the harbour view bar upstairs is stunning. Stay there!
reviews.title: Great views, good location. Luxury.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights /4days last week of July while on a weekend trip with Wife. The property is spanking new having been around for only a year or so. Though compared to some its competitors (Excelsior, Marriot etc) perhaps the location is not ideal, that is it is not smack bang in the centre of causeway bay, however it is located barely a 5 minute walk away from the Fortress MRT & the bus stop from where it takes max another 5 to 7 minutes to get to the main commercial streets/buildings, be it Central or Times Square etc. Taxis are also easily available, plus the whole public transport system in Hong Kong is so good that the location is hardly a bother. Plus being perhaps on a less crowded street/area is the reason why the Lobby & the size of the rooms & other common areas is on an average far bigger than any other Hotel in Hong Kong. Plus each & every room offers a great view of the Hong Kong Harbor, though I would recommend one goes for an upgrade & books on the club floors (Floors 35 to 40) for the best views. Plus the club lounge facility over all is great value & as are again the views from the club lounge on the 41st floor. The rooms are well furnished though perhaps it caters to the more bling taste of the new rich from Mainland China hence there is an overwhelming sense of faux luxury & gold platting every where. I mean a T.V. in the bathroom to my mind was a bit too much. That apart the hotel also offer a pillow menu. Breakfast selection is good though not great. The 3 days we ate there the buffet menu didnt change though there is a vast number of dishes to choose from including a veg Indian section. Now the not so great part, Service, this is a bit patchy. All the staff seem keen to help, however they are not consistent & dont seem to be experienced enough in the service industry. The conceirge for instance depending on who was manning the booth ranged from good to average on days. Moreover there was a mix up with regards to our room rate, & the folks at the front office on day one where not sure if our rate included breakfast in it or not & it took a mail/call from our travel desk to sort it out. Over all though these are minor niggling issues & would recommned this place to anyone wanting to experience a quick five star holiday . To my mind if one gets a standard room here for around the 900 Hong Kong Dollar mark breakfast included, one should go for it. Added advantage the A11 bus from the airport drops you just two minutes off the hotel in 50 minutes flat. P.S. Special tahnsks to their front office manager Andy who stepped in when ever there was some minor clarification/help needed, which made our stay smooth.
reviews.title: Value for Money stay at a Hotel with Super views ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon as we passed through Hong Kong. After the craziness of the wedding, and a week in Bali, we honestly hadn't thought much about the hotel we'd be staying in in Hong Kong. We expected to be out on foot most of the day. However, we were completely blown away by how beautiful and immaculate the Harbour Grand Hotel was. We upgraded to a club room with only came out to about $200 more for our 3 nights there, and this included a buffet breakfast (pancakes, dim sum, cereal, sausages, eggs, danishes, etc etc) also a free cocktail and appetizer hour (actually open for 2 hours).
reviews.title: Lovely Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were perfectly fine for 2 of us - the king bed was huge and soooo comfortable, they even offer a menu of different pillows for you to choose from! The bathroom fixtures were modern and fun, and the view was breathtaking (a harbour view from every room!)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: It ended up raining hard for most of our time there, and though we made it to a few site seeing locations, we were so comfortable and happy at the hotel, we really didn't mind watching the rain on the harbour through all the floor to ceiling windows :)
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good location

aka: Harbour Grand Hong Kong Hotel Hong Kong
description: Harbour Grand Hong Kong, an icon of the finest luxury hospitality, is the latest 5-star hotel managed by Harbour Plaza Hotels & Resorts. Ideally located at the heart of Hong Kong Island, each of the Harbour Grand Hong Kong's 828 rooms enjoys unobstructed views of the world renowned Victoria Harbour. Nestled amongst the fashionable shopping areas and commercial offices of Causeway Bay, Wanchai and Central; the property is conveniently situated within walking distance of Hong Kong's extensive Mass Transit Railway (MTR) system. Harbour Grand Hong Kong has won numerous awards since opening, including the Overall 2012 Winner of World Luxury Hotel Awards and the Luxury City Hotel by 2012 World Luxury Hotel Awards received recently.
